text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response explicitly warns the client to seek legal advice before taking action and specifically mentions the risk of making an unjustified threat of proceedings under the Trade Marks Act 1994 in the initial disclaimer section: \"Acting without advice could weaken your position or lead to counterclaims (e.g., for invalidity of your mark).\" Furthermore, Step 3, which details sending the Cease and Desist letter, strongly advises drafting it via a lawyer to avoid DIY action that could lead to counterclaims, which aligns with the intent of the criterion (reducing the risk associated with direct, unadvised contact).", "criterion_id": "679ca6f9-102e-4ceb-b690-564de65e8eb7"}
